channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Iraq's shopping centre fire leaves 61 dead, many missing
item.description: Videos on social media appear to show a number of people on the roof during the fire in the city of Kut.

item.title: Pope expresses sadness after Israeli strike on Gaza church kills three
item.description: Israel's prime minister says it "deeply regrets that a stray ammunition hit" the Catholic Church of the Holy Family in Gaza City.

item.title: Syria leader vows to protect Druze after sectarian violence prompts Israeli strikes
item.description: Ahmed al-Sharaa spoke after Israel said it would destroy government forces it accused of attacking Druze in Syria.

item.title: Who are the Druze and why is Israel attacking Syria?
item.description: A fresh wave of deadly sectarian violence has rocked Syria, highlighting the country's fragile security landscape.

item.title: US says 'specific steps' agreed to end Syria violence after Israeli strikes hit Damascus
item.description: Israel says it is "working to save our Druze brothers", but Syria accuses it of "treacherous aggression".

item.title: At least 20 killed in crush at US-backed GHF aid site in Gaza
item.description: For the first time, the Israel and US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation confirms deaths at one of its sites.

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 12 in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley, governor says
item.description: The Israeli military said it had struck a number of military compounds belonging to the armed group Hezbollah.

item.title: Gaza father's outrage after Israeli strike kills son 'searching for sip' at water point
item.description: Mahmoud Abdul Rahman's son, Abdullah, was among six children who died at a water distribution point in Gaza on Sunday.

item.title: Yemen postpones execution of Indian nurse on death row
item.description: Nimisha Priya, who was sentenced to death for the murder of a Yemeni man, was set to be executed on Wednesday.

item.title: Dozens killed in clashes between Druze and Bedouin in southern Syria
item.description: Fighting continues in parts of Suweida province as the Syrian interior ministry sends forces to intervene.

item.title: BBC Gaza documentary breached guidelines, review finds
item.description: BBC failed to disclose the narrator of Gaza: How to Survive a War Zone was the son of a Hamas official.

item.title: Iran president was reportedly injured in Israeli strikes
item.description: Iran's Fars news agency says President Masoud Pezeshkian had a leg injury when his secret site was hit in June.

item.title: Gaza officials say children killed in strike as Israeli military admits 'error'
item.description: Six children waiting for water are among those killed in an Israeli air strike, emergency service officials say.

item.title: Gaza hospital says 24 people killed near aid site as witnesses blame IDF
item.description: Witnesses say Israeli troops opened fire as people were trying to get food. The IDF says there were no known injuries.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire talks on verge of collapse, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Senior Palestinian officials accuse Israel of deliberately stalling the negotiations in Qatar during the prime minister's US visit.

item.title: Israeli settlers kill Palestinians in West Bank attack, health ministry says
item.description: A US citizen was beaten to death and a Palestinian shot and killed when Israeli settlers attacked Sinjil, the Palestinian health ministry says.

item.title: 'They were just kids': Mother mourns sons killed in Israeli strike while waiting for aid
item.description: Two of Iman al-Nouri's five sons were killed outside a clinic in Deir al-Balah on Thursday, while a third was seriously wounded.

item.title: Outrage builds over plan to force all Gazans to southern city
item.description: Critics denounce a plan by Israel's defence minister to relocate all Palestinians in Gaza to a small area in the south.

item.title: Netanyahu visits US as Trump puts pressure to agree Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: Israel's prime minister is under pressure from Donald Trump and people at home to agree a new ceasefire and hostage release deal.

item.title: Israel's strike on bustling Gaza cafe killed a Hamas operative - but dozens more people were killed
item.description: The attack raises more questions over whether Israel’s use of force is proportionate, as required by international law.

item.title: 'I don't know who to trust anymore': Druze worry about being left behind in post-war Syria
item.description: Recent attacks on the religious minority in Damascus have fuelled growing distrust towards the state.

item.title: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
item.description: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

item.title: A month into Gaza's new aid system - killings, gunfire and chaos are routine
item.description: A month into the resumption of aid distribution in Gaza there have been repeated reports of killings, with a BBC Verify analysis of dozens of videos showing chaos and panic as people head to get aid.

item.title: Iran carries out wave of arrests and executions in wake of Israel conflict
item.description: Iranian authorities have carried out arrests and executions of people suspected of links to Israeli intelligence agencies.

item.title: Watch: BBC reports from severely damaged Syrian defence headquarters
item.description: The deadly unrest, along with the violent Israeli strikes, have re-ignited fears of a security breakdown in Syria

item.title: Watch: How a day of bombing unfolded in Damascus
item.description: Israel has intensified its airstrikes on Syria, including near the presidential palace and on the defence ministry headquarters in central Damascus.

item.title: Former Mossad official details how Israel eliminated Iran's military elite
item.description: The former deputy chief of the Israeli intelligence explains how technology and innovation played a key role for Israel in the 12-day conflict.

item.title: 'Iran pulses with anger and even deeper grief', says BBC's Lyse Doucet
item.description: Lyse Doucet witnesses a mass state funeral for prominent figures killed in the recent conflict with Israel.

item.title: BBC inside Iran state TV building hit by Israeli missile strike
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the ruins of an Iranian state TV building hit during the conflict with Israel.

item.title: Watch: BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from Iran on the ceasefire with Israel
item.description: Lyse Doucet reports from the streets of Tehran, where she says things are staring to return to normal.
